api.title: API Reference
api.description: The following content is for DocSearch v3. If you are using DocSearch v2, see the legacy documentation.

crawler.title: DocSearch x Algolia Crawler
crawler.description: If you're not finding the answer to your question on this website, this page will help you. If you're still unsure, don't hesitate to send your question to us directly.

DocSearch-program.title: DocSearch program
DocSearch-program.description: If you're not finding the answer to your question on this website, this page will help you. If you're still unsure, don't hesitate to send your question to us directly.

DocSearch-v3.title: Getting Started
DocSearch-v3.description: The following content is for DocSearch v3. If you are using DocSearch v2, see the legacy documentation.

how-does-it-work.title: How does it work?
how-does-it-work.description: Getting up and ready with DocSearch is a straightforward process that requires three steps: you apply, we configure the crawler and the Algolia app for you, and you integrate our UI in your frontend. You only need to copy and paste a JavaScript snippet.

integrations.title: Supported Integrations
integrations.description: We worked with documentation website generators to have DocSearch directly embedded as a first class citizen in the websites they produce.

manage-your-crawls.title: Manage your crawls
manage-your-crawls.description: DocSearch comes with the Algolia Crawler web interface that allows you to configure how and when your Algolia index will be populated.

migrating-from-v2.title: Migrating from DocSearch v2
migrating-from-v2.description: This page lists the differences between the DocSearch v2 and DocSearch v3 API, you can also take a look at the exhaustive API reference list and the Getting started guide.

required-configuration.title: Required configuration
required-configuration.description: This section, gives you the best practices to optimize our crawl. Adopting this following specification is required to let our crawler build the best experience from your website. You will need to update your website and follow these rules.

styling.title: Styling
styling.description: The following content is for DocSearch v3. If you are using DocSearch v2, see the legacy documentation.

templates.title: Config templates
templates.description: To help you create the best search experience for your users, we provide config templates for multiple websites generators. If you'd like to add a new template to our list, or believe we should update an existing one, please send us an email or open a pull request.

tips.title: Tips for a good search
tips.description: DocSearch can work with almost any website, but we've found that some site structures yield more relevant results or faster indexing time. In this page we'll share some tips on how you can make the most out of DocSearch.

who-can-apply.title: Who can apply?
who-can-apply.description: Open for all developer documentation and technical blogs.
